TextWidget.Caption: Info
TextWidget.Text: Muesli is a popular breakfast meal based on uncooked rolled oats and other products based on grain, fresh or dried fruits, nuts, and mixed with milk, soy milk, yogurt or/and fruit juice. It was developed around 1900 by Swiss physician Maximilian Bircher-Benner for patients in his hospital. It is available in a packaged dry form, ready made, or it can be made fresh.

TextWidget.Caption: Ingredients
TextWidget.Text: • 3 cups of rolled oats • ¼ cup of sunflower seeds • ½ cup of slivered almonds • ¼ cup of hazelnuts • ½ cup of desiccated coconut • ¼ cup of pumpkin seeds • ½ cup of honey • 1 ½ tbs of canola oil • ½ cup of dried cranberries or apricots, roughly chopped • Milk and or yogurt to serve

TextWidget.Caption: Directions
TextWidget.Text: 1. Pre-heat the oven to 300F. 2. Heat the honey and vegetable oil in a small saucepan over a low heat. Gently simmer for 4 minutes. 3. Meanwhile, in a large bowl combine the rolled oats, the nuts, the seeds and the coconut. 4. Add the warm honey mixture to the bowl and stir well to coat the dry ingredients. 5. Spoon the oats onto a large rimmed baking sheet and spread out. 6. Bake the ingredients for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. 7. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Add the dried fruit and stir to combine. 8. Serve with milk and/or yogurt.
